passages.text: Market Insights | Markets | Equities 市场洞察 | 市场 | 股票
Strategy: Europe gets a flavour of its own - GREAT BACK TO SCHOOL report

Sharon Bell's latest report is an excellent read for anyone involved in European Equities, both if Europe is your bread- and- butter daily or if you want to take note of 2025 so far & what's next. Here what you need to know with great supporting charts at the bottom:
Sharon Bell的最新报告对于任何涉足欧洲股票的人来说都是一篇极佳的阅读材料，无论你是每天都在深耕欧洲市场，还是只是想了解截至目前 的 2025 年走势及未来趋势。以下是你需要了解的要点，底部还附有精彩的图表支持：

1. EPS d/g driven by USD - Europe has easily outperformed the US in USD terms YTD but in reality - since March - SXXP has moved sideways on tariffs uncertainty and disappointing earnings. Consensus has now -1% EPS growth for 2025 vs 8% in January, but the majority of the downgrade was led by USD decline.
EPS下调由美元驱动——以美元计价，今年迄今欧洲的表现轻松跑赢美国，但实际上，自3月以来，由于关税不确定性和令人失望的盈利表现，SXXP一直横盘整理。市场一致预期2025年EPS增长从1月份的8%下调至- 1%，但大部分下调是由美元贬值所导致的。

2. Europe still under-owned by the Europeans - GSR was spot on forecasting 0% EPS growth, this year, they have 4% for 2026 and they expect 5%/8% price/total return for SXXP in 12m driven by European economies improving (GSR is ahead especially an German growth), low positioning by domestic as European funds have >40% of holdings in US equities vs 15% in 2009, and the desire to diversify.
欧洲投资者仍然低配欧洲——GSR 准确预测了今年 EPS 增长为 0%，他们预计 2026 年为 4%，并预计未来 12 个月 SXXP 将录得 5%/8% 的价格/总回报，驱动力来自欧洲经济改善（尤其是德国增长方面 GSR 领先），以及本土投资者低配的现状——目前欧洲基金持有的美国股票占比超过 40%，而 2009 年仅为 15%——还有分散投资的需求。

3. Europe and US had the same 3y EPS CAGR - Europe gets a bad reputation but see ex.8 below as, converting earnings both into USD, we have seen almost identical US and European earnings performance on a 3y EPS CAGR. This is a stark contrast
vs 2009- 22 when Europe u/p on the back of Financials & Energy.
欧洲和美国的3年每股收益复合年增长率（EPS CAGR）相同——欧洲名声不佳，但请参见下方图表8，将收益都换算成美元后，我们看到美国和欧洲在3年EPS CAGR上的表现几乎一致。这与2009年至2022年形成鲜明对比，当时欧洲因金融和能源板块表现不佳而落后。

4. Different style leadership in the 2 sides of the Atlantic - Performance styles in the US and Europe could not have diverged more this year. Value (Banks, Insurance, Utilities, Telecoms) outperformed in Europe while growth (Tech/AI) outperformed in the US. The US has become more concentrated, while in Europe, concentration has faded and is below average. And we also see it in the outperformance of Small caps in Europe vs. underperformance of Small in the US.
大西洋两岸的风格领导截然不同——今年美国和欧洲的表现风格差异巨大。欧洲的价值股（银行、保险、公用事业、电信）表现优异，而美国的成长股（科技/人工智能）表现突出。美国市场的集中度进一步提高，而欧洲的集中度则下降至低于平均水平。这一点也体现在欧洲小盘股的优异表现与美国小盘股的落后表现上。

5. It's hard for Europe to rotate back into Growth and Quality - Since the GFC, European stocks with the best profit growth have been either USD earners (benefiting from US economic growth, high drug pricing and USD appreciation) and/or China-exposed stocks (benefiting from strong China GDP); the GRANOLAS fit these categories. But now these macro forces have shifted and, in some cases, reversed.
欧洲很难重新转向成长和优质——自全球金融危机以来，欧洲利润增长最好的股票要么是美元收入股（受益于美国经济增长、高药价和美元升值），要么是对中国高度敞口的股票（受益于中国GDP的强劲增长）；GRANOLAS符合这些类别。但如今这些宏观驱动因素已经发生变化，甚至在某些情况下出现逆转。

6. EU Cyclicals vs Defensives is not actually close to the highs - ex Financials and Healthcare, there is nothing extraordinary about Cyclical/Defensive performance and arguably, it is still under-pricing the economic improvement in 2026 (Exhibit 11).
欧盟周期性板块与防御性板块的表现实际上并未接近高点——除去金融和医疗保健板块，周期性/防御性板块的表现并无特别之处，可以说仍低估了2026年的经济改善（见图表11）。

7. Sector allocation remains a barbell - OW Banks, Telecoms, Tech, Retail vs US Automotive, Chemicals, Energy. Check ex.15 to see the magnitude of European fiscal vs US Chips Act and US IRA: EU programmes are at least 50% bigger.
行业配置依然呈杠铃型——超配银行、电信、科技、零售，低配美国汽车、化工、能源。参见图表15，了解欧洲财政刺激与美国《Chips Act》和《IRA》的规模对比：欧盟项目至少大 \(50\%\)
Europe is still now owned enough by Europeans. Despite same 3v EPS CAGR vs the US. The cyclical improvement helped by fiscal is yet to be reflected looking at adjusted Cyclicals vs Defensives pair.

Exhibit 6: Over \(40\%\) of equity holdings by European funds are in the US vs. \(15\%\) in 2009 Euro Area Investment Funds' holdings in US and Euro Area equities \((\%)\) of total equity holdings). Data to 20 2025. Total Holdings of Euro Area Funds in Equities: EUR 7.5 trillion
Exhibit 6: Over \(40\%\) of equity holdings by European funds are in the US vs. \(15\%\) in 2009
Source: Datastream, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 8: Realised EPS growth 3-year CAGR
Source: Datastream, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 11: Cyclicals have bounced but with more mixed performance under the surface \\* EA consensus avg 4- quarter forward annualise q/q real GDP growth (with 1- quarter lag)
Source: Datastream, FactSet, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 15: Our economists expect a sharp rise in fiscal and defence spending in Europe Major Fiscal Programmes/Proposals
\\*Lighter blue indicates fraction of RRF still to be disbursed / \\*\\*only Energy and climate initiatives
Source: European Commission, Haver Analytics, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 16: How fiscal policy is priced 24m fwd PE
Source: Bloomberg, Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research

Edoardo L. Greco  Executive Director - Franchise Sales  Global Banking & Markets - Equities Division - Goldman Sachs International  +44 (0) 20 7051 1594 - 25 Shoe Lane - EC4A 4AU - London - United Kingdom
